{"rating": 7.0, "genres": ["Action", "Drama"], "review": "This movie was so good, it was the best thing I have seen this year. It is like a love story with a twist. I saw the first part of this movie as a movie about two young men who fell in love with each other but then they were separated because of their different beliefs and social classes. This is not that movie at all. The second part continues the journey of both men.br br One of my favorite parts is when the characters talk about why they are fighting for what they believe in. And how hard it is to be a soldier especially when you don't even know why you're fighting. They also talk about why you need God by your side. Another great scene is where the hero saves his friend from drowning in the river and then he finds out that his friend was actually a traitor. So now his friend is dead and the hero is blamed for it. The ending is very moving and makes you think about life a lot more than I usually do. I would watch this movie again just to see how it ends. Its a really good movie if you want to learn something new or get some inspiration from it.", "num": 8674068}

{"rating": 7.3, "genres": ["Documentary", "Music"], "review": "This film follows the owner/chef of Grace, Curtis Duffy, during his transition from sous chef to chef. In addition, the plot is predictable.br br The movie follows the drama of Grace and the struggles of a chef transitioning to ownership of his own restaurant.br br The restaurant was created from a garage, and it is clear from the film that the construction is not yet complete. There is some evidence that the filming was rushed to completion, resulting in an unfinished product.br br The film focuses primarily on Curtis Duffy. However, there are interviews with other members of the management and staff, and these brief interviews are interesting to watch.br br Overall, this is not a quality documentary.", "num": 6646749}

{"rating": 7.6, "genres": ["Action", "Documentary"], "review": "This is the true story of the events leading up to the creation of the first Special Forces Brigade of the U.S. Army. This movie includes interviews with several actual members of the team that created SF, including Col. Ralph Spangler and Lt. Col. John Clark. These men were among the founders of the SF Brigade and had a direct hand in establishing the philosophy and doctrine of the elite SF unit. The film also includes interviews with the current commanding officer of the SF Regiment, Col. William Lakin, and his deputy, Maj. Richard Stidham, who both played key roles in the establishment of the unit.br br In addition to these interviews, the film contains archival footage depicting the establishment of the unit, plus some historic photos and other images related to the events depicted. Also, I contacted other studios and retailers online. None of them have a version of this movie in English.br br One more thing. In the beginning, they have the credits rolling and there's music playing. The title appears on the screen and the picture goes black for a second or two, then resumes. {"rating": 4.9, "genres": ["Drama", "Romance"], "review": "As soon as I saw this movie I knew it was a classic. I had seen this movie a few years ago and never forgot it. It took me awhile to find the DVD but when I found it, I realized why I loved it so much. The actors are terrific and they all have great chemistry together. You really feel like you get to know them and their characters. They don't talk too much which adds to the intensity of the scenes. It was filmed in beautiful locations in California, not Mexico. There are several sex scenes, not many for a PG13.br br The director has made other great movies such as Once Upon a Time, and The Last Fall. He seems to really understand how to work with actors, camera angles, and music. The film uses real music from the time period, which adds greatly to the atmosphere. {"rating": 7.7, "genres": ["Biography", "Documentary"], "review": "I have never read a book like this before. The author is very good at writing and spelling the names of places and persons correctly and accurately. Many other biographies I have read misspell names and spell the same thing more than once.br br The author explains a lot of the details of the story, but I still feel there is some missing information. I wonder if anyone reading this will know why it was so difficult for Dr. Dre to finish his musical composition and why he was so concerned about the title. It is stated that the title is a reference to the movie, The Godfather. The movie is a metaphor for death row inmates.br br The author also gives the reader insight into the character of some of the participants and their motivations. For example, he mentions that the first Death Row record was meant to be a protest against the conditions of prisons in general and specifically towards the treatment of Tupac Shakur.br br I highly recommend this book for anyone who wants to know more about Dr. Dre and Death Row Records. The author doesn't focus on the business aspects of the enterprise. Instead, he concentrates on the musicians and their relationships.", "num": 7884894}

{"rating": 6.8, "genres": ["Biography", "Drama"], "review": "A good movie about a flawed human being, and that is an accurate representation of reality.br br Like most biographies, it is often inaccurate and it is also fictionalized, which is ironic considering the topic.br br The author is biased towards the subject and as such, the documentary is unbalanced. It's obvious to most intelligent adults that the writer/director is biased. Some of his sources are reliable, others are questionable. His footnotes indicate that he obtained access to documents and tapes that were never intended for public consumption.br br As a former special forces soldier, I have an appreciation for the sacrifices made by the veterans and heroes in Vietnam.br br Although the documentary touches briefly on the atrocities committed by the U.S., it lacks depth and compassion regarding the victims of the Vietnam War.br br The documentary focuses exclusively on Richard Nixon's political career. Nothing is said about the war crimes, nor is there any mention of the widows and orphans of the 25 million Vietnamese people who perished from Agent Orange. Additionally, no credit whatsoever is given to the Vietnamese patriots who fought valiantly against the invaders. Instead, the focus is purely on the Nixon administration.br br Overall, I strongly recommend watching this documentary, but only after reviewing the facts using other reliable sources, including eyewitness accounts.", "num": 3384160}

{"rating": 7.8, "genres": ["Crime", "Drama"], "review": "This is a movie about a young college grad, who moves to Seattle for a job with a new law firm. Her roommate is the sexy, free spirit, Liz, who loves her life in the city and her job at a coffee shop. While the protagonist is content with her career and her lifestyle, her roommate is not, and decides to start an adventure of her own.br br When she meets a local artist, Alex, she finds herself caught in a web of lies, deceit, and betrayal. She realizes that there are forces working against her, and discovers a secret that has been keeping her apart from her loved ones.br br The director manages to deliver a compelling tale, which keeps you glued to the screen. Although it deals with some difficult subjects, it addresses them in a mature manner, giving it an adult tone instead of a teen flick, as many horror movies tend to do. Additionally, the cinematography and editing adds to the overall quality of the film. However, the acting lacks the realism needed to convey the intensity of the situations. Overall, the film succeeds in portraying the dangers of lying and deceiving others.br br Highly Recommended.", "num": 7917295}

{"rating": 6.8, "genres": ["Action", "Drama", "Western"], "review": "Another solid B film from Italian director Pasquale Di Paolo. Once again, the film is inspired by true stories about assassins. This time the subject is Carlos Delargo, a Spanish military officer who moves to Morocco in search of adventure and fortune. He sets up a club called ''the Dead League'' and works alongside a colorful cast of characters including an English aristocrat named Lord Arthur, the mysterious Count de la Tour, and a female assassin named Sira. The movie has a classic tone and atmosphere, and while the plot is not original, it's well executed.br br A nice feature is the opening scene which tells us of the relationship between Delargo and the African slave woman Chiki. They have a touching moment where Chiki tells Delargo that she wishes to die in his arms. Unfortunately, the film goes downhill from here on out. The storyline gets sloppy and confusing, and the second half drags along slowly and unsatisfactorily.br br Still, the movie is worth seeing for the opening scene and for its exotic locations, which include the deserts of Africa and the bustling city of Casablanca. The acting is generally good, especially that of the leading actor Carlos Delgado, and the actresses are pretty. The scenery is beautiful, and there are some interesting fights and chases, although the plot gets messy and complicated towards the end.br br The soundtrack is quite impressive, featuring classical music such as Wagner's Ride to the Death.br br The DVD release is fine. It includes three bonus features: a commentary track by the director, a recording of a traditional North African dance, and a photo gallery. Also included is a booklet containing information about the movie and its production. Overall, it's a decent B movie.", "num": 8532796}

{"rating": 7.9, "genres": ["Drama"], "review": "First of all, I liked the movie itself. Really nice movie. However, my copy of the DVD was missing the first disc. The only thing in the box was the second disk. I checked the Amazon site to see if I missed a listing. Apparently, there were lots of versions of this movie available on Amazon, all different, some with extras. Some of them had reviews which seemed plausible. Others were questionable. This one was listed as having a blue-ray dvd in addition to the regular dvd. In any event, I gave it a chance and hoped that it was OK. It was a complete disappointment. The audio track was scrambled. It sounded like a bunch of birds chirping. I couldn't figure out what to do. It made it impossible to enjoy the movie.br br I'm a huge fan of Tom Hanks. Loved Castaway, Citizen Kane, Mamma Mia, etc. I bought this dvd hoping it would be as entertaining as those movies. Instead, it was annoying and boring.br br I contacted the seller and asked if the seller could mail me the missing dvd. Seller responded positively, stating that they would mail it immediately. I mailed a return package overnight express delivery and have not heard from them since. Seems like a waste of money sending back the defective dvd.br br Bottom line - I gave this movie 2 stars because the dvd was missing the first disc. I gave it 1 star because it was annoying and boring. It seems the director was not interested in creating a good movie.br br I would suggest watching it again and ordering a replacement dvd with the missing first disc. If you are buying it to view, make sure the dvd is intact and contains the first disc.", "num": 4486396}

{"rating": 7.0, "genres": ["Documentary"], "review": "This is a great documentary. It gives you a glimpse into the secret lives of the CIA and the military. The filmmakers do an excellent job of exposing the corruption of the system. However, I think it's unfair to say that the CIA and military are just as guilty as the NSA. The fact that the NSA collected all the data means they had the opportunity to monitor and analyze the data they gathered. The NSA probably had access to more information about al Qaeda and other terrorist groups than the CIA. The CIA didn't necessarily have to compile the data, but they certainly were gathering it. Also, they are accusing the CIA of being too secretive and too focused on protecting their own. It's absolutely true that the CIA protects its own, but that isn't unique to the NSA or the CIA. Any organization dedicated to national security has a vested interest in preventing dissent. It's actually good to have a check on all levels, and not just the executive branch.", "num": 5230331}

{"rating": 6.8, "genres": ["Country", "Western"], "review": "This movie is a great piece of history of the Texas music scene. It covers from the beginning, to the peak of the commercial era. The characters portrayed are accurate and well described. This film shows how the musicians struggled to survive during that period.br br One of the main reasons I purchased this DVD is because I am a musician. The music scenes captured in this movie are remarkable. There are several different types of music included. Some of the music is easy to identify, others were unfamiliar. The production value and quality of the recordings are outstanding. It is clear that a lot of effort went into recording and mixing this movie. Some of the material is difficult to understand, but overall it is excellent.br br Another reason to purchase this DVD is because I have a special interest in the career of Buddy Holly. He is one of my favorite musicians. I love the fact that his contributions are highlighted in this movie. He was an incredible artist and pioneer of rock n roll. His impact on the music industry is undeniable. He is responsible for changing the world of music forever. I enjoy watching the various performances of his songs.br br Overall, I highly recommend this movie to anyone interested in learning more about the Texas music scene. It provides an exceptional viewing experience and captures a unique aspect of American culture.br br I would definitely purchase this DVD again.", "num": 4703034}

{"rating": 6.3, "genres": ["Comedy"], "review": "It is a strange movie. It is weird. It is a mystery. There is a lot of confusion in the beginning. It seems a mystery because it is confusing. {"rating": 8.2, "genres": ["Crime", "Drama", "Mystery"], "review": "First of all, its not a movie. Its a documentary. Second of all, if you're expecting a movie, dont watch it. I heard the story about the rise and fall of the Grimaldi brothers. I've never seen anything like it. First, you hear the story and then you watch the documentary.br br I like watching documentaries about people. People who seem ordinary but who somehow manage to stand out from the crowd. People like Tony Soprano, George Foreman, Sammy Davis Jr., and the Grimaldi brothers. This dvd contains interviews with the brothers, family members, associates, other subjects related to the casino scene. The film includes footage of the brothers when they were young. You learn what it was like to grow up in the neighborhood, how they started gambling, how they became the biggest mafia empire ever. It shows how it was in Las Vegas during the early 70s. At times, the camera captures the reality of the situation, and it becomes clear that there was no script. The narration tells the story and that makes it worth watching.br br I recommend this dvd. Not for everyone, not for everyone. The way the film is edited, the pacing, the length of some scenes, and the fact that it's mostly interviews. However, if you like documentaries, this is one for the shelf.br br - The 3rd installment of the trilogy of movies and tv shows that focused on the Grimaldi brothers. {"rating": 7.9, "genres": ["Animation", "Comedy"], "review": "A wonderful film with a fascinating premise, that is unfortunately hampered by a lack of nuance.br br The concept is that a group of filmmakers decide to make a horror film, in the style of Silent Hill, but using actual zombies instead of actors. However, they realize that the living dead are just as unpredictable as the human characters, thus forcing them to deal with a situation entirely different from what they expected.br br Unfortunately, this creates numerous problems in terms of plot structure and pacing.br br The entire film takes place in a single location, the film makers' cabin in the woods. Not only does this restrict the scope of the narrative, but makes it difficult to understand how each character reacts to the situation. Instead of showing various points of view, we are stuck with a protagonist who is the only one who seems to have any realistic reactions, despite having limited screen time. The other characters barely exist outside of situations that require them to react to whatever happens.br br Additionally, the pace is erratic, sometimes progressing quickly through scenes, but other times stalling. At times, we are given detailed descriptions of how to shoot the scenes. Other times, we are rushed through them.br br In addition, the writing lacks subtlety. Virtually everything the characters say is delivered in shockvalue.br br Nevertheless, the premise holds potential. It is unfortunate that the execution fell apart.", "num": 8273883}

{"rating": 5.3, "genres": ["Action", "Adventure", "Sci-Fi"], "review": "Dan Patrick isn't just a TV personality, he's also a writer and director. For those who haven't seen his previous movies, he's known for roles such as George Jetson on The Jetsons, as well as the various films he's directed including Mars Attacks!, Family Man, and Bill & Ted 2.br br Patrick's latest directorial effort, called 2012, takes place during a worldwide catastrophe and follows the story of a young man named Alex Mason. During the chaos and unrest, Alex attempts to save the world from total destruction.br br Although I found the premise interesting, I was disappointed in the acting, especially by the lead actor Chris Hemsworth, whose lack of emotional range is clearly evident in each of his performances.br br The supporting cast includes Michael Almerson, who appeared in The Fountainhead, and Amanda Young, who appeared in The Secret Life of the American Teenager. {"rating": 6.3, "genres": ["Horror", "Mystery"], "review": "When I first heard about the movie, I didn't know much about it. The only thing I knew was it was filmed in Mexico and was released in 1984. I'm guessing it was considered a horror film but I didn't realize until watching the DVD that it was actually more of a thriller. The story is about a woman named Hannah who travels to a small town in Mexico and stays with her uncle, Jack. His daughter, Sarah, is missing, and she and her boyfriend, David, have disappeared. Hannah helps to search for them, and she meets a young girl named Carmen. Things go awry when Hannah begins to think that Sarah may have been murdered and hidden somewhere on the property.br br As I mentioned earlier, the movie was filmed in Mexico and it shows. It has a rustic feel to it and it's a tad slow paced. While the acting isn't fantastic, I enjoyed the performances. The plot is good, and it keeps you intrigued throughout the entire film. While it's not a horror film, I liked it nonetheless.br br Also included is a commentary track which provides a behind the scenes look at the film. It's worth watching as it contains interviews with the actors and director, as well as footage from deleted scenes and behind the scenes material. It's interesting to see the making of this film and gives you a greater understanding of what went on during production.br br Overall, I recommend this DVD to anyone who likes thrillers, or those who enjoy films with foreign settings. It's definitely worth adding to your collection.", "num": 9912800}

{"rating": 5.4, "genres": ["Biography", "Drama"], "review": "This is a wonderful film! The acting is spectacular and the story itself is fascinating. I've watched it several times now and continue to marvel at its greatness.br br I have not seen any other film that covers such a wide range of emotions, nor have I ever felt so emotionally involved with a story. There are few films where the main character truly falls in love with the person he is supposed to kill. This is one of those rare movies.br br The characters are wonderfully portrayed, especially Nicole Lagel, as she portrays a young woman torn apart by conflicting feelings about whether or not to kill the man she loves. The cinematography is remarkable, capturing the beauty of the French countryside as well as the emotional intensity of the main characters.br br I highly recommend this film, particularly if you enjoy movies about historical drama, romance, and drama, especially if you are not familiar with it.", "num": 709}

{"rating": 6.9, "genres": ["Documentary"], "review": "What an amazing movie about this legendary group of men that created an international phenomenon. Not only did they create a sound but a unique fashion style. From a simple bunch of young men from Detroit, Michigan, they evolved into global icons. The film provides a historical perspective of the evolution of this amazing band. As a fan, I was pleased to learn many facts about this band. Also, included are interviews with many of the members. Another interesting aspect of the film is that it shows how some of the musicians managed to thrive despite the obstacles they faced in dealing with drugs and alcoholism.br br The documentary provides a glimpse of the inner workings of the music business. It shows the challenges the band faced with securing a publishing contract and landing a record deal. Additionally, it portrays the intense competition between bands in the 70s for industry recognition.br br Overall, a great film that deserves a viewing by anyone who enjoys watching movies about music groups. There are plenty of films about the Rolling Stones, Zeppelin, Floyd, Doors, etcetera, but none compares to the brilliance of this film.", "num": 5098676}
